comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: The very early Manly ferry PS Phantom (paddle box and single tall white funnel with black top) can be seen at her lay-over wharf at Dawes Point. Having been built in parts near Glasgow and assembled in Melbourne in 1858, she came to Sydney in 1859 and became the first regular Manly ferry. She left the Manly service in 1878 and was broken up in 1885.
